title: 110_hr3830
content: The "Fisheries Restoration and Irrigation Mitigation Act of 2007" amends the funding for priority projects and cost sharing. The amendment reduces the funding from $5,000,000 to $2,500,000 for certain projects. Section 7(c) of Fisheries Restoration and Irrigation Mitigation Act of 2000 is amended to allow the Secretary to accept amounts from the Bonneville Power Administration without further appropriation or fiscal year limitation. These amounts can be credited towards the non-Federal share of project costs. SEC. 4. REPORT. Amends Section 9 of the Fisheries Restoration and Irrigation Mitigation Act of 2000 to include partnering with local governmental entities and States in the Pacific Ocean drainage area. SEC. 5. AUTHORIZATION OF APPROPRIATIONS. Section 10 of the Fisheries Restoration and Irrigation Mitigation Act of 2000 is amended to extend the timeframe to 2008 through 2014. It also defines administrative expenses as costs related to staffing, overhead, and processing funding applications. The Program allows for funding applications, with a limitation of 6% for administrative expenses. Half of this amount goes to State agencies assisting with the Program. The Program provides funding for administrative expenses, with 6% allocated for this purpose. Half of the administrative funding goes to State agencies for technical assistance and staffing. The Program provides funding for administrative expenses, including staffing expenditures for arranging meetings, assisting applicants with applications, and providing technical assistance at construction sites.
